main event: A round white-colored light, the size of a pinhead, was observed moving at high speed, with fast acceleration, and at very high altitude over Indianapolis, Indiana on September 23, 1958.
interesting points: The object was observed for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
The object appeared stationary at an elevation of 25 degrees.
The object was described as having the characteristics of a star or planet.
No sound was heard from the object.
The object was moving in a westerly direction.
sighted object: a round white-colored light, the size of a pinhead
